Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.Utils
public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains implementation of the useful actions in the system. All methods in the class are static and contain:

  • group of copy stream methods to move I/O content
  • group of making collections methods to simplify creation of some kinds of collections
  • group of resource loading methods to simplify loading any resources into application
  • group of wrapping and unwrapping arrays of primitive types
  • group of walking methods to unify walking algorithms in applications
  • group of file and directory manipulation methods
  • group of useful methods for checking purposes

All the methods in the class are thread-safe

Copying streams

Copying streams methods allow to automate popular process of moving content from input streams to output streams. This group of methods consists of:

  • copyStream(InputStream, OutputStream) and copyStream(InputStream, OutputStream, ProgressIndicator) methods to copy byte content
  • copyStream(Reader, Writer) and copyStream(Reader, Writer, ProgressIndicator) methods to copy character content
  • copyStream(CharacterSource, CharacterTarget) method to copy Pure Library specific character sources

Methods to copy can contain a ProgressIndicator for visualization purposes.

Making collection methods

These methods are used to simplify making collections. These methods were appeared because of historical reasons. The latest JRE versions contains come intersected methods now, and we strongly recommend to use them instead of appropriative deprecated methods. This group of methods contains:

  • mkSet(Class, Object...) method to create set of content
  • mkMap(Object...) method to create map of content
  • mkProps(String...) method to create props of content

Loading resources into application

Standard methods to load resources into application are Class.getResource(String) and Class.getResourceAsStream(String), but they load only byte-oriented content. To simplify loading for other resource types, group of loading resource methods can be used. This group contains fromResource(Reader), fromResource(URL) and fromResource(URL, String) methods to load char-oriented content into application

Wrapping and unwrapping primitive arrays

Sometimes you need to upload primitive arrays content to arrays of appropriative wrapped types (for example, byte->lava.lang.Byte}. Group of methods allow you to make both wrapping and unwrapping for there arrays. It contains:

  • wrapArray(boolean[]) methods to upload primitive arrays to appropriative wrapped arrays.
  • unwrapArray(Boolean[]) methods to upload arrays of wrapped values to appropriative primitive arrays.

This group contains methods for all the primitive types

Walking on linked structures

Walking on linked structures is a popular functionality. Group of the methods contains:

  • walkDownEverywhere(Object, EverywhereWalkerCollector, EverywhereWalkerCallback) method to walk from node into depth
  • walkUpEverywhere(Object, EverywhereWalkerCollector, EverywhereWalkerCallback) method to walk from node to root

All the walking methods are controlled by Utils.EverywhereWalkerCallback interface. Every node in the walking trace processed twice:

  • when entered into given node (NodeEnterMode value = NodeEnterMode.ENTER)
  • when exited from given node (NodeEnterMode value = NodeEnterMode.EXIT)

It's guaranteed, that every node entered will be called as node exited. Code returned (it's type is ContinueMode) notifies walker for controlling of walking process. Usual value is ContinueMode.CONTINUE, but you can truncate some walking subgraphs by it.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

      Parameters:
      is - input stream to copy from
      os - output stream to copy to
      Returns:
      length transferred (in bytes)
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any I/O exception was thrown
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when any problems with parameters

    • copyStream

      public static long copyStream​(java.io.InputStream is, java.io.OutputStream os, ProgressIndicator progress) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.NullPointerException

      Copy one byte stream to another with progress indicator

      Parameters:
      is - input stream to copy from
      os - output stream to copy to
      progress - progress indicator to use
      Returns:
      length transferred (in bytes). If copying was interrupted, returns negative value of partially transferred data
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if any I/O exception was thrown
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when any problems with parameters
      Since:
      0.0.3

      Returns:
